master.commit_message:
Update docs building to be aligned with readthedocs

* add .readthdocs.yaml
* change theme
* remove redundant makefile

release 1.12.1

* Enable tox macro of fedora builds

Include tox.ini in source distribution (#71)

While building source downstream in Fedora with pyproject-rpm-macros
I noticed tox.ini was not in tarball. We need it in order to take
avantage of macro like %tox [1] to run the unit tests or build the doc.
Until now, we are copying/pasting the commands in the SPEC file [2].

[1] https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/packaging-guidelines/Python/#_tox
[2] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python-wsgi_intercept/blob/rawhide/f/python-wsgi_intercept.spec#_69

Make a 1.12.0 release

- pining urllib3 to <2.0.0

Pin urllib3 to < 2.0.0 (#70)

2.0.0 introduces several changes that we can accomodate,
eventually, but for the time we need to prevent general
failures.

Also update automated tests to remove python 2.7, 3.5, 3.6

pin-urllib3.commit_message:
Pin urllib3 to < 2.0.0

2.0.0 introduces several changes that we can accomodate,
eventually, but for the time we need to prevent general
failures.
